wikipedia_page.main: Siobhan O'Neill is an English actress and musician born in Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire. She is notable for her work in television, including Thor: The Dark World, TV sitcom Him and Her, TV sitcom Not Going Out starring Lee Mack and BBC TV medical series Holby City. Siobhan O'Neill is also the drummer for all-sister rock band Kyneska (formerly Emerald Sky). She has recently filmed the role of the Housemaid in The Suspicions of Mr Whicher - The murder in Angel Lane, alongside Olivia Colman and Paddy Considine, directed by Christopher Menaul for Hat Trick Productions and ITV.

response: * Actresses and musicians Siobhan O'Neill, Aislinn O'Neill and Ceara O'Neill currently reside in the village.

Larry Flick from Billboard wrote, "U.K. newcomer comes on like a cross between Terence Trent D'Arby and Lenny Kravitz on this keyboard-driven funk'n'soul jam." The Daily Vault's Jason Warburg stated that it is "an obvious club track with its propulsive synthesizer melody and driving rhythm section. The Shaft guitar part closing out the bridge is a nice touch, too, demonstrating just how effectively Seal has grafted synthesized dance music onto its funk roots." Pan-European magazine Music & Media called it "adventurous techno-pop by this promising UK singer who sang on Adamski's recent hit single Killer. Produced by Trevor Horn, this classy, galloping mix of funk, soul and pop is currently riding high on the UK charts. Europe should be next." Bob Mack from Spin noted Seal's "stirring vocal that's being compared to Marvin Gaye" and added that "based on a '70s cop-show-type bass synth line, "Crazy" flows natch enough that you hum along on first listening." Siobhan O'Neill commented on the song in the 2010 book 10,001 Songs You Must Hear…, "Full of drug and dance scene references, "Crazy" blends soulful lyrics and husky vocals with Horn's trademark sweeping orchestration and a voguish electronic backing—a combination that, in the wake of this and Massive Attack, became the template for a whole strand of dance music."
